<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D"></a>

# AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D

**Inherits:** [AnimationRootNode](AnimationRootNode.md) **\<** [AnimationNode](AnimationNode.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A set of [AnimationRootNode](AnimationRootNode.md)\\ s placed on a virtual axis, crossfading between the two adjacent ones. Used by [AnimationTree](AnimationTree.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A resource used by [AnimationNodeBlendTree](AnimationNodeBlendTree.md).

\ **AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D** represents a virtual axis on which any type of [AnimationRootNode](AnimationRootNode.md)\\ s can be added using [add_blend_point()](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_add_blend_point). Outputs the linear blend of the two [AnimationRootNode](AnimationRootNode.md)\\ s adjacent to the current value.

You can set the extents of the axis with [min_space](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_property_min_space) and [max_space](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_property_max_space).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Using AnimationTree](../tutorials/animation/animation_tree.md)

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_BlendMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **BlendMode**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_BlendMode)

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_constant_BLEND_MODE_INTERPOLATED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[BlendMode](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#enum_AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_BlendMode) **BLEND_MODE_INTERPOLATED** = `0`

The interpolation between animations is linear.<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_constant_BLEND_MODE_DISCRETE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[BlendMode](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#enum_AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_BlendMode) **BLEND_MODE_DISCRETE** = `1`

The blend space plays the animation of the animation node which blending position is closest to. Useful for frame-by-frame 2D animations.<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_constant_BLEND_MODE_DISCRETE_CARRY"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[BlendMode](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#enum_AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_BlendMode) **BLEND_MODE_DISCRETE_CARRY** = `2`

Similar to [BLEND_MODE_DISCRETE](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_constant_BLEND_MODE_DISCRETE), but starts the new animation at the last animation's playback position.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_property_max_space"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **max_space** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_property_max_space)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_max_space**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_max_space**\ (\ )

The blend space's axis's upper limit for the points' position. See [add_blend_point()](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_add_blend_point).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_property_min_space"></a>

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_min_space**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_min_space**\ (\ )

The blend space's axis's lower limit for the points' position. See [add_blend_point()](AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D.md#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_add_blend_point).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_property_snap"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_snap**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_snap**\ (\ )

Position increment to snap to when moving a point on the axis.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_property_sync"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **sync** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_property_sync)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_use_sync**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_using_sync**\ (\ )

If ``false``, the blended animations' frame are stopped when the blend value is ``0``.

If ``true``, forcing the blended animations to advance frame.

## Method Descriptions

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_add_blend_point"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_blend_point**\ (\ node\: [AnimationRootNode](AnimationRootNode.md), pos\: [float](float.md), at_index\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_add_blend_point)

Adds a new point that represents a `node` on the virtual axis at a given position set by `pos`. You can insert it at a specific index using the `at_index` argument. If you use the default value for `at_index`, the point is inserted at the end of the blend points array.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_get_blend_point_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_blend_point_count**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_get_blend_point_count)

Returns the number of points on the blend axis.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_get_blend_point_node"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[AnimationRootNode](AnimationRootNode.md) **get_blend_point_node**\ (\ point\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_get_blend_point_node)

Returns the [AnimationNode](AnimationNode.md) referenced by the point at index `point`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D_method_get_blend_point_position"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Returns the position of the point at index `point`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>
